result.execSummary:
The defendant Chet W Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist/Obstruct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 6 months or penalty of 2 days Jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chet W Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Defendant Chet W Coleman in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend charge to Resisting/Obstructing contrary to ordinance 13.102(c)(7), Wisconsin Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid within 6 Months; Failure to pay; defendant to serve 2 days jail.
